movies.title: Les hommes sans ailes
movies.plot: After an attack against the guard of the Third Reich, Nazi repression intensifies, and the Czechoslovakian resistance's organized sabotage in an aircraft factory leads to Gestapo shootings...  »
movies.simplePlot: After an attack against the guard of the Third Reich, Nazi repression intensifies, and the Czechoslovakian resistance's organized sabotage in an aircraft factory leads to Gestapo shootings....

biography.bio: Gustav Nezval was born on November 18, 1907 in Brünn, Austria-Hungary as Augustin Nezval. He was an actor, known for Les hommes sans ailes (1946), Le piège (Il faut tuer Sekal) (1998) and Nocní motýl (1941). He was married to Gertrude Nettel. He died on September 17, 1998 in Prague, Czech Republic.
biography.name: Gustav Nezval

biography.placeOfBirth: Prague, Bohemia, Austria-Hungary [now Prague, Czech Republic]
biography.bio: Ladislav H. Struna was born on June 27, 1899 in Prague, Bohemia, Austria-Hungary as Ladislav Herbert Struna. He was an actor, known for A zivot jde dál (1935), Du samedi au dimanche (1931) and Les hommes sans ailes (1946). He died on February 14, 1980 in Prague, Czechoslovakia.
biography.name: Ladislav H. Struna

biography.bio: Jaroslav Zrotal was an actor and writer, known for Les hommes sans ailes (1946), The Hen and the Sexton (1951) and Frona (1954). He died on June 13, 1969 in Prague, Czechoslovakia.
biography.name: Jaroslav Zrotal

biography.bio: Vladimír Hlavatý was born on October 29, 1905 in Prague, Bohemia, Austria-Hungary as Vladimír Michael Hlavatý. He was an actor, known for Lost Children (1957), Footprints (1961) and Les hommes sans ailes (1946). He died on October 27, 1992 in Prague, Czechoslovakia.
biography.name: Vladimír Hlavatý

biography.placeOfBirth: Adamov, Ceské Budejovice District, Bohemia, Austria-Hungary [now Czech Republic]
biography.bio: Jan W. Speerger was born on April 29, 1895 in Adamov, Ceské Budejovice District, Bohemia, Austria-Hungary as Jan Wacslaw Spergr. He was an actor and director, known for Milenky starého kriminálníka (1927), Velbloud uchem jehly (1926) and Pozdní láska (1935). He died on June 25, 1950 in Prague, Czechoslovakia.
biography.name: Jan W. Speerger

biography.bio: Jaroslav Seník is an actor, known for The Proud Princess (1952), Les hommes sans ailes (1946) and Cervená jesterka (1949).
biography.name: Jaroslav Seník

biography.bio: Ladislav Hajek is an actor, known for Les hommes sans ailes (1946), Muzikant (1948) and La barricade muette (1949).
biography.name: Ladislav Hajek

biography.bio: Dr. Peyer is an actor, known for Les hommes sans ailes (1946).
biography.name: Dr. Peyer

biography.bio: Jirina Petrovická was born on January 30, 1923 in Pardubice, Czechoslovakia as Jirina Zemlicková. She was an actress, known for Tobe hrana zvonit nebude (1979), The Secret of Blood (1953) and Nahá pastýrka (1966). She died on October 10, 2008 in Prague, Czech Republic.
biography.name: Jirina Petrovická

biography.bio: Eduard Linkers was born on October 11, 1912 in Czernowitz, Bukovina, Austria-Hungary as Ludwig Linkers. He was an actor, known for La marquise d'O... (1976), Confidential Report (1955) and A Farewell to Arms (1957). He died on April 3, 2004 in Wartenberg, Bavaria, Germany.
biography.name: Eduard Linkers

biography.bio: Paula Valenska was born on July 2, 1922 in Melník, Czechoslovakia. She is an actress, known for The Gay Adventure (1949), Dnes neordinuji (1948) and Saturday (1945).
biography.name: Paula Valenska

biography.placeOfBirth: Prague, Bohemia, Austria-Hungary [now Prague, Czech Republic]
biography.bio: Marie Nademlejnská was born on June 27, 1896 in Prague, Bohemia, Austria-Hungary. She was an actress, known for Witchhammer (1970), Devcica z Bezkyd (1944) and The Blue Star Hotel (1941). She died on January 24, 1974 in Prague, Czechoslovakia.
biography.name: Marie Nademlejnská

biography.bio: Alois Dvorský was born on October 24, 1883 in Horice, Bohemia, Austria-Hungary as Alois Vanícek. He was an actor, known for Lemonade Joe (1964), Záhadný prípad Galginuv (1924) and Workers, Let's Go (1934). He died on October 10, 1966 in Prague, Czechoslovakia.
biography.name: Alois Dvorský

biography.bio: Ferdinand Jarkovský was born in 1888 as Ferdinand Mejkal. He was an actor, known for Les hommes sans ailes (1946), He Stood at the Till (1939) and Duchacek Will Fix It (1938). He died in 1978.
biography.name: Ferdinand Jarkovský

biography.bio: Frantisek Marek was born on September 3, 1904 in Praha, Csehország, Ausztria-Magyarország. He was an actor, known for Closely Watched Trains (1966), Les hommes sans ailes (1946) and Golden Queen (1965). He died in 1981 in Praha, Czechoslovakia.
biography.name: Frantisek Marek

titlesAwards.titleAwardOutcome: Won Grand Prize of the Festival
